segments.text: I notice the woman is so focused on drying that plate, she doesn’t even see the water spilling everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her apron is spotless, but the floor is turning into a lake, and she doesn’t care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching so high to reach those cookies, and the stool looks like it’s about to tip.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the girl is just waiting for her turn, completely oblivious to the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cookie jar is almost empty, and the kids are going to get caught any second now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the sunlight coming through the window, making the whole scene look so normal, but it’s anything but.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just cascading down the cabinets, and it’s only going to get worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever realize what’s happening behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy’s foot is slipping on the stool, and I can’t watch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think someone needs to step in before this whole kitchen turns into a mess.
segments.speaker: PAR
